What is Air Quality?
Air quality describes the amount of pollutants in the air that we breathe, and it is directly linked to poor health. One pollutant in particular is nitrogen dioxide (NO2), a gaseous pollutant emitted from cars. The Sheffield Childrenâ€™s hospital is an area with heavy traffic flow, and therefore NO2 levels substantially exceed the Air Quality Guidelines (AQG) of the World Health Organisation (WHO).


What are Green Barriers?

Our Project
